Banana Pancakes
200g flour
35g sugar
15g baking powder
1.5g salt
3 bananas (extra ripe), roughly mashed
2 eggs
200ml milk
35g butter, melted
1tsp vanilla
  1. Sieve the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt into a bowl
  2. Put the bananas in a second bowl and mash - a potato masher is good for this, or if they're really ripe the electric mixer will break them down
  3. Add the eggs, milk, butter and vanilla to the bananas and beat well to combine
  4. Pour the dry ingredients into the banana mix, and combine with as little mixing as possible
  5. Fry over medium to low heat, in a non stick pan with a little butter. Flip when bubbles form on the surface and the underside has browned
Footer. Not much here really. Nice to have a footer though.
